vulnerabilities.description: Remote Code Execution in Elasticsearch client

analysis.justification: Elasticsearch client is used for product search functionality. RCE allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on search service and access customer database.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Product search is internet-facing. RCE could allow attacker to access all customer PII and payment data. PCI DSS breach. IMMEDIATE PATCHING REQUIRED.

vulnerabilities.description: Arbitrary file upload vulnerability in multer
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade to multer 1.4.6 or later immediately

analysis.justification: Multer is used for product image uploads by sellers. Arbitrary file upload allows uploading web shells leading to RCE.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Seller dashboard allows image uploads. RCE could compromise entire platform. Emergency patch scheduled for tonight.

vulnerabilities.description: Webhook signature verification bypass in Stripe SDK

analysis.justification: Stripe webhooks are used to confirm payment completion. Signature bypass allows attackers to forge payment confirmations and receive goods without paying.
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Payment webhooks are internet-facing. Bypass = free merchandise. Financial fraud. PCI DSS violation. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

analysis.justification: express-session is used for user authentication. Weak session IDs allow brute force attacks to hijack customer accounts.
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Session hijacking = unauthorized access to customer accounts and payment methods. GDPR breach. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

analysis.justification: Next.js image optimization is used for product images. SSRF allows scanning internal network and accessing AWS metadata service (IAM credentials).
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. SSRF could expose AWS credentials and allow full account takeover. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

analysis.justification: Redis client is only used for session storage and cart caching. All keys are generated server-side and not user-controllable.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: Command injection requires user-controlled Redis commands. Our implementation only uses GET/SET with server-generated keys. Scheduled for next maintenance window.

analysis.justification: Axios is only used for outbound requests to shipping APIs (FedEx, UPS). All URLs are whitelisted and not user-controllable.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: Prototype pollution requires user-controlled request config. Our implementation only makes requests to pre-configured shipping endpoints. Scheduled for next maintenance window.

analysis.justification: Investigating whether cookie-parser is used in a way that allows session fixation attacks.
analysis.detail: MEDIUM PRIORITY: Code review in progress to determine exploitability. Upgrade planned for next sprint.
